item.description: There's no place like $HOME Below I describe my home folder layout and why I do things the way I do, maybe (or maybe not) you'll get something out of it. It's a little excessive, perhaps, but I enjoy it. . ├── archive # old files by creation year, maybe useful again ├── 2019 └── 2019-01-01_file.txt # ISO-8601 date format is king, fight me └── 2020 | ├── backups # I use restic (and timeshift, but not in this dir) | ├── inbox # where all my unsorted downloads begin | ├── library # actually a symlink to my Dropbox folder on a secondary HDD | # ^^ sorted downloads end up here ├── art ├── books ├── {DDS/LoC} # classification schema └── shelf # currently reading or soon-to-read ├── music ├── photos ├── scrots # aka screenshots ├── videos └── walls # aka wallpapers | ├── org # life admin: CVs, bank statements etc | ├── projects # code, websites etc | └── wiki # a bunch of interlinked markdown files, once managed by vimwiki └── diary # I've since moved to Joplin as it's became really awesome in 2019.
